body:
This is likely not related to grpc. I think the following should fix your
problem:

``` c
HelloRequest request;
request.mutable_nameMsg()->set_name("hello");
```

Please refer to the documents of protobuf here:
https://developers.google.com/protocol-buffers/docs/reference/cpp-generated?hl=en#embeddedmessage

On Mon, Jan 25, 2016 at 6:24 AM, Gregor Lämmel notifications@github.com
wrote:

> In pre-release 0120 (commit a9c61bc
> https://github.com/grpc/grpc/commit/a9c61bc512758afab2fbc7c7635c8baf2f38a722
> ):
> If a field type of a message is again a message I get a ``double free or
> corruption'' on return
> To reproduce edit grpc/examples/protos/helloworldproto and change
> HelloRequest to this:
> 
> // The request message containing the user's name
> message HelloRequest {
>   Name nameMsg = 1;
> }
> 
> message Name {
>   string name = 1;
> }
> 
> adapt grpc/examples/cpp/helloworld/greeter_cc accordingly If I build and
> run, the server side runs fine but on the client side I get:
> *_\* Error in `/greeter_client': double free or corruption (out):
> 0x00007ffdaa451e00 ***
> [1] 26734 abort (core dumped) /greeter_client
> 
> Here https://githubcom/grpc/grpc/files/103321/exampleszip are all
> modified files from the example in order to reproduce this issue
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/4870.
Thank you so much! This fixes my problem indeed. Will read protobuf docs once more thoroughly :-)
